record.title: EXTENSION OF MORNING BUSINESS
record.narrative:
EXTENSION OF MORNING BUSINESS -- (Senate - December 05, 2007)

[Page: S14759]
record.chair: The Senator's time under morning business has expired.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask for 4 additional minutes to finish my statement.
Mr. President, I was going to use the occasion to ask unanimous consent that following the Senator from Washington speaking, I would like to be recognized for up to 10 minutes in morning business.
Mr. President, we have a number of Senators on our side seeking recognition. Perhaps we can put that together fairly quickly.

record.chair: The Chair notes that at this time, there is 5 minutes left in morning business for the Republican side. The Democratic side has used all of its time in morning business.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that morning business be extended to include 4 minutes for myself, the Senator from Washington----
Ten minutes to the Senator from Texas, 5 minutes to the Senator from Montana, 10 minutes to the Senator from Illinois.

Mr. President, I assumed we were going to go off morning business and onto the calendar. I was going to speak for 20 minutes, so I will speak in line of appearance on the floor for 20 minutes at whatever appropriate time that is.
I add that to the consent request, that if there are Republican Senators who would like intervening times, in between, we include those as well in the unanimous consent request.

Reserving the right to object, and I will not object, I express my appreciation to the Senator from Washington for allowing Republican Senators to intervene and the extent to which Democratic Members speak, I would like to make sure we have equivalent time on our side. I think we can work that out.
That is included in my request. I ask additionally that Senator Menendez be allowed 10 minutes as well as the end of that unanimous subsequent request.

record.chair: Is there objection? The Senator from Montana.

speaking.paragraph: I ask that my 5 minutes be expanded to 10 minutes.

record.chair: Does the Senator so modify her request?
The request is so modified. Is there objection to the existing unanimous consent request? Without objection, it is so ordered.
